rajawali.math

Class Matrix4

  • java.lang.Object
    • rajawali.math.Matrix4

  • public final class Matrix4
extends java.lang.Object
    Encapsulates a column major 4x4 Matrix. Rewritten August 8, 2013 by Jared Woolston with heavy influence from libGDX
    Author:
    dennis.ippel, Jared Woolston (jwoolston@tenkiv.com)
    See Also:
    This class is not thread safe and must be confined to a single thread or protected by some external locking mechanism if necessary. All static methods are thread safe.

      Matrix4 setAll(Vector3 xAxis, Vector3 yAxis, Vector3 zAxis, Vector3 pos)
      Sets the four columns of this Matrix4 which correspond to the x-, y-, and z- axis of the vector space this Matrix4 creates as well as the 4th column representing the translation of any point that is multiplied by this Matrix4.

      Sets the homogenous scale of this Matrix4.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix4

        public Matrix4()
        Constructs a default identity Matrix4.

      • Matrix4

        public Matrix4(Matrix4 matrix)
        Constructs a new Matrix4 based on the given matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix4 The matrix to clone.

      • Matrix4

        public Matrix4(double[] matrix)
        Constructs a new Matrix4 based on the provided double array. The array length must be greater than or equal to 16 and the array will be copied from the 0 index.
        Parameters:
        matrix - double array containing the values for the matrix in column major order. The array is not modified or referenced after this constructor completes.

      • Matrix4

        public Matrix4(float[] matrix)
        Constructs a new Matrix4 based on the provided float array. The array length must be greater than or equal to 16 and the array will be copied from the 0 index.
        Parameters:
        matrix - float array containing the values for the matrix in column major order. The array is not modified or referenced after this constructor completes.

      • Matrix4

        public Matrix4(Quaternion quat)
        Constructs a Matrix4 based on the rotation represented by the provided Quaternion.
        Parameters:
        quat - Quaternion The Quaternion to be copied.

                       double fov,
                       double aspect)

        Parameters:
        near - double The near plane.

        Returns:
        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.

      • setToOrthographic2D

        public Matrix4 setToOrthographic2D(double x,
                          double y,
                          double width,
                          double height)
        Sets this Matrix4 to an orthographic projection matrix with the origin at (x,y) extended to the specified width and height. The near plane is at 0 and the far plane is at 1.
        Parameters:
        x - double The x coordinate of the origin.
        y - double The y coordinate of the origin.
        width - double The width.
        height - double The height.
        Returns:
        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.

        y - double The y coordinate of the origin.
        width - double The width.

        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.

        tz - double The z component of the translation.
        sx - double The x component of the scaling.
        sy - double The y component of the scaling.
        sz - double The z component of the scaling.
        Returns:
        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.

      • setToLookAt

        public Matrix4 setToLookAt(Vector3 direction,
                  Vector3 up)
        Sets this Matrix4 to a look at matrix with a direction and up Vector3. You can multiply this with a translation Matrix4 to get a camera Model-View matrix.
        Parameters:
        direction - Vector3 The look direction.
        up - Vector3 The up axis.
        Returns:
        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.

      • setToLookAt

        public Matrix4 setToLookAt(Vector3 position,
                  Vector3 target,
                  Vector3 up)
        Sets this Matrix4 to a look at matrix with the given position, target and up Vector3s.
        Parameters:
        position - Vector3 The eye position.
        target - Vector3 The target position.
        up - Vector3 The up axis.
        Returns:
        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.

      • setToWorld

        public Matrix4 setToWorld(Vector3 position,
                 Vector3 forward,
                 Vector3 up)
        Sets this Matrix4 to a world matrix with the specified cardinal axis and the origin at the provided position.
        Parameters:
        position - Vector3 The position to use as the origin of the world coordinates.
        forward - Vector3 The direction of the forward (z) vector.
        up - Vector3 The direction of the up (y) vector.
        Returns:
        A reference to this Matrix4 to facilitate chaining.
